result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawntae A. Beson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shawntae A. Beson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shawntae A. Beson was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.

records.addlTxt: 2:41 p.m. Defendant Shawntae A. Beson in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Defendant Shawntae A. Beson in custody.  Mary M Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 17cm358 and 16cm550. Sowinski states agreement/Shawl concurs. Victim rights legislation complied in 16cm550. In 16cm550, State moves to amend to ordinance retail theft - Granted. In 17cm358 - State moves to amend Count 1 to ordinance obstructing and to dismiss Count 2 - Granted. Defendant enters no contest pleas. Court accepts no contest fees and imposes forefeiture and costs in amount of $263.50 in each case. Court calls 17tr789, 16cm136 and 17fo631 - defendant is being held on fail to pay warrants. Court orders upon $400, defendant may be released from ONSO. Court approves payment plan to include all cases in amount of $100/monthly payment. Adj. 2:49 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for February 26, 2018 at 03:00 pm.
per Amy at ONSO in custody
Notified Connor at ONSO - partial payment made - warrant will be reissued
defendant sent in $20 money order - remailed back as she has 3 active FTP warrants- PO box was vacant/closed - applied the $20 to this case and clerk to redo warrant
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant
terminated - regular
Notified Jack, ONSO - quashed by court on 4/19/17

In receipt of 16cm550 Shawl will enter not guilty plea - 
Schiek /Shawl statement to bail -Court reinstates sig bond -

1:33 p.m. Defendant Shawntae A. Beson in court. Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Mary Burns appearing specially. Defendant recently got new job; requests payment plan. Court statement--questions nonappearance; warrant quashed.  Review hearing scheduled for December 5, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant
and States Reply to Discovery

2:24 p.m. Defendant Shawntae A. Beson in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Schiek states agreement. State moves to dismiss Count 2 in 16cm136, 16tr714, 16tr713 and 16tr712 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1 in 16cm136 and 16tr780. Court finds defendant guilty in 16TR780 and imposes fine of $200.50.  In 16cm136, Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Richards/Court statement on sentencing.

WHS/POP - 12 months cc with Vilas County case

  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.

Appeal rights given. Payment application plan given.
Adj. 2:38 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

1:34 p.m. Defendant Shawntae A. Beson in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns for Attorney Steven Richards.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cm136, 16tr712, 16tr713 and 16tr714.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea. Schiek/Burns statement on bail. Court sets $500 sig bond. Adj. 1:37 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
